alert.note: Alert for Lyon; O'Brien; Osceola (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 1:51PM CDT until August 05 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN LYON, CENTRAL O`BRIEN AND WESTERN OSCEOLA COUNTIES... At 151 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, with 5 inches west of Ashton and 3.5 inches near Primghar. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sibley, Hartley, Sanborn, Primghar, Sutherland, Little Rock, Ashton, Melvin and Calumet. Heaviest rainfall will continue in areas between Sanborn and Hartley toward Melvin through 3 pm. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
